At bedtime, the newer iPad was at 100% still, the Galaxy at 97%, the old iPad at 96%, and the MeMO pad was dead.Today after testing the battery on video playback, I left the Galaxy and MeMO sitting next to each other and came back to check later. Galaxy was down to 90%. MeMO was at 82%. I have it on the ultrasaver power setting. I just don't get why it would run down so fast.Next comparison - displays. My 4th Gen iPad is beautiful, and I thought I might be a little spoiled, but the MeMO's display is very clear. Video renders smoothly with excellent motion. Resolution is 1280 by 800 (compared to 1024 x 600 on the Galaxy). Totally doable. The Samsung seemed less smooth. However, the Samsung performs better on sound and touch. Dialogue is a bit muddy on the MeMO, and upper range is not quite bright. The touchscreen seems to have the slightest hint of lag, as does the accelerometer. Not terrible. But noticeable.The MeMO pad camera is a lot better than the Samsung - especially in low light - but nowhere near as good as the 4th Gen iPad (which also has led flash).In terms of form factor, the MeMO is a little bit bigger, but still fits in your hand. Not sure it would fit in a pocket like the Galaxy. Or that you would want to put it in one, since the MeMO is lighter and seems quite a bit less sturdy. It will fit in a very small man-bag or pocketbook.As for pre-loaded software, features, etc., the Galaxy comes with a nice voice assistant, but you can get a very similar app for free at the app store for the MeMO. Galaxy has better alarm sounds (I think), but both alarms are reliable and fairly customizable.So which little android tablet is better? Well, with the battery issue, I have to say the Galaxy is better. By quite a bit. The MeMO would be great for portable entertainment, if the battery lasted longer. Without good battery life, the thing just isn't that portable. And the lower price doesn't make up for it. Not in my opinion, anyway.OTOH, if you're looking for something that will be plugged in most of the time, like a bedside tablet/alarm/home automation controller, this will be great and it does save you some money over the Galaxy and a ton of money over any iPad.

Reviews.Title: A Terrific Product !!
Reviews.Author: Comtap
Reviews.Content: Worth every Penny,  I recently bought the Dragon Touch 7in tablet from amazon for my wife for a present and it was a total piece of garbage and sent it back and bought this instead. and the Asus Memopad HD is Fantastic it cost way less than a kendel fire but with all the same funcionality. I highly Recomend this to anyone looking to get a new tablet.  she has played with it heavly for 4 days so far and it still has half a charge on the battery before it runs down.great Picture Quality on Screen and taken with the Cameras both front and back.fast and easy to usegood operating systemgreat 10 touch display very responsivethis is a MUST BUY!!  we are very happy with it

Reviews.Title: In this price it was the best one I found
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Dupree
Reviews.Content: Great value tablet this one. Whilst some reviewers have commented on the construction of tablets, saying it feels a little cheap and breakable, I have found it to be a study little thing, sure it feels light weight but you are not going to beat a whale to death with it, are you? It should be light weight and functional.  The resolution is better than its predecessor and the only complainers will be those looking for a hard core gaming platform, which this is not (no would you expect it to be given the price) and those who want to show off their cliquey device. Another reviewer commented on a power lag but I can’t say I have ever experienced a problem and I use this tablet for email and creative writing.

Reviews.Title: perfect.
Reviews.Author: cactus
Reviews.Content: this tablet is just the right size and the quality is better than it should be at this price point.i've had mine since they were first available and i waited till i put some miles on it before i reviewed it.it's great.the android operating system is showcased perfectly in this machine. just enough apps, awesome display, mico sd card reader, slim and light. it's perfect right out of the box (i did run the firmware update after i charged it)!i've pushed it hard and it won't freeze.i can't really give you examples of torture tests, because i take care of my stuff. however, i do like to tweak my computers, and i feel that this one is good enough as it is.i put off buying a tablet till this one came out and it payed off for me.it's just a great quality and well engineered product.

Reviews.Title: computer heaven
Reviews.Author: DMC "DMC"
Reviews.Content: awesome awesome awesome... this pad does it all.  i say Asus hit it on the head.fast. and fantastic graphics. the reaction and capabilities of this pad are like lighting.Asus has made the world of computers easier to take with you..... goood bye  laptop!

Reviews.Title: Have some serious issues, still a good bargain for price. Not very satisfied, but that's life.
Reviews.Author: Ravi
Reviews.Content: It was a gift to someone old who couldn't use it. So I decided to keep for myself. 5 days of usage and issues started to show up.1. The body is fragile and loose as if there are some screws left untight. There chripring noise if you move tablet up and down slowly. That makes sure this tablet is not made with due care or one can blame entirely in plastic body too.2. "Micro SD card unexpectely removed" which if happens during watching a movie or playing games becomes very annoying. Since one can move couple of apps without rooting this tablet the problem multiplies as you either keep all necessary apps on phone storage or get sudden card removed notice.3. WiFi is horribly disconnecting even though I'm a half meter away from my router. This makes surfing stressful and failed downloads. Annoying when I download large files and all of a sudden WiFi gets disconnect. Reception of WiFi is also not great as it should be. On my mobile I get full strength signal in my next room whereas this tablet struggles.4. Too many unwanted apps by Asus. Don't know if I require any ever. Have disabled them, can't uninstall.Now some positive - this machine is beast in speed, usage and battery life. Be it playing high def games or be it running tab on WiFi for almost 10 hours or watching movies this tablet doesn't disappoint.Screen is superb, glows well outdoors and pretty viewable. Lacks automatic brightness but one wouldn't require if not used too often in changed environment like in and out too frequently.Camera is adequate for Skype or Google hangout (Skype's old version is running well, new one keeps crashing). Rear camera is decent for random clicks. Gives good result. Video recording too is very clear and in HD.No problems faced using any app as of now. All games and apps supported. Looking to buy a miracast display adapter preferably netgear ptv3000. One thing that stops me doing so is mood of returning it back. Have written to Amazon and guys were very nice. Let's see how it pans out.Taking away 2 stars for micro SD issue, weak WiFi and plastic body which is very fragile to hold. Could have given 5/5 with double thumbs up had these issues were not there. Also worried on warranty as being a user in India I doubt Asus India will oblige worldwide warranty as they are sort of unprofessional here.Will keep updated as and when I see anything to be shared. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: it's what i had hoped for
Reviews.Author: MATTHEW EDDY
Reviews.Content: Really love this tablet, does everything I want and has the ability to expand it's storage with the micro sd slot.  Screen can be a little bad with glare but a matte finish screen protector really helped cut that down.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Rick Paterala
Reviews.Content: Best tablet I have found for the price.  Not complaints as of yet, wifi connection extends the entire range of the home over 3,000 sq ft.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Kandace Roque
Reviews.Content: I have had it for a few days now and I love it! The screen display is crystal clear. Movies and TV shows look perfect. I love the color on the back. It is extremely thin so I will be looking into getting a cover for it. Both cameras are surprising good and take a decent picture. I was pleasantly surprised at how long the battery lasted, about 11 hours. It runs smoothly, the apps open up and load within 2 seconds. I know people who have the Galaxy Tab 3 and it runs the same, if not better. If you are looking for a tablet and don't want to pay $200 or more, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: My Daughter Loves it
Reviews.Author: Rocket Rancher "Laura"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter; she's a junior in college. Said she didn't need a tablet so much to take notes, but needed it to keep electronic "handouts" the professors give her. She loves it and I am jealous. I'm thinking of getting myself one.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMOPad HD 7-Inch 16 GB Tablet, Blue (ME173X-A1-BL)
Reviews.Author: Beatlelover
Reviews.Content: Fantastic... Great sound, very responsive... Picture is crystal clear, very comfortable to hold in one hand... Tried a basic Acer Iconia before purchasing the ASUS, the ASUS put it to shame... I wish I had the money to hand these out to family and friends... I have an ASUS laptop and have had it about 6 mos; love ASUS products! Thank you for a wonderful product!

Reviews.Title: Memo Pad Android 4.2 issue
Reviews.Author: Planker
Reviews.Content: The tablet is excellent for the price. The only major issue is that there are no physical navigation buttons, only soft keys.The soft key bar takes up almost a 1/2" of diagonal screen space, reducing the actual screen size to 6.5".Asus needs to work with Google to create an Android update that will allow full screen by hiding the soft keys or making them semitransparent. This would greatly improve the user experience.

Reviews.Title: MicroSD problem
Reviews.Author: Hung N.
Reviews.Content: It's working good. But there was a little bit problem. When I tried to move it around, then MicroSD card slot won't recognize my "microSD" and I put on table micrSD works again.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Marie Daniels
Reviews.Content: My first tablet yeah! Its pretty nice for the price and really easy to setup. The manual says that you should fully charge it before turning it on for the first time. Didn't take long to do that. Also within a few minutes there was a OS upgrade that took about 15 minutes to download and install. Its not to heavy, looks nice and for the price I can get past the finger prints lol. Also make sure to go online and register it. Anyway I would recommend if you need this one buy it.

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: Cindy R. Triplett
Reviews.Content: This was a purchase made by my husband.  It is exactly what he wanted, and therefore makes me happy (not dealing with his unhappiness)

Reviews.Title: Great Value for your money
Reviews.Author: diego
Reviews.Content: What an awesome tablet, this device's screen it's awesome for the price point, the performance is more than adequate, at least for my girlfriend that just plays The Simpsons and UNO and open like 15 tabs on Chrome, runs all without problems, battery life is good too but what we're in love is with the design and that beautiful green color. The cameras suck but that was not the reason we bought it. For the price point go get a device with a decent screen, good overall performance, good size and good speaker output. Fully recommended

Reviews.Title: New Tablet - A Great Value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "MrCTX1"
Reviews.Content: The ASUS MeMOPad HD7 is a great little tablet for the price.  I was considering several others, with the main contender being the Kindle Fire HD.  This won out because of full Android functionality, SD-card port, and price.  I have not regretted the choice, two weeks in use.  I will update again in a few weeks.Here are the negatives:  Adobe is no longer supporting Flash, so Amazon Prime Instant Videos do not work - I somehow missed that when doing my prelim work.  This might change if Amazon upgrades to HTML5 for its video feeds.  The other negative is the lack of a mini-HDMI port.  While neither of these are huge issues for me, they are important enough for most tablet seekers to warrant the note and the lack of the 5th star.The first sentence really says it - this is a great tablet for the price.  If I could I would rate it 4+.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Paula S "History Buff"
Reviews.Content: Did not want a  Kindle because I have a Nook but love that the Kindle app works great for me on the MeMo. Great size and I have no problems with it at all. In fact I use it much more than my IPad !

Reviews.Title: I love my ASUS MemoPad HD 7-Inch
Reviews.Author: Ms. G.
Reviews.Content: I've only had my ASUS for a short time but so far it is much more than I expected for the price. It's quick and it has loads of apps.  I also find it quite user friendly.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jennem
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that I did not have unreasonable expectations for a tablet selling for only $149 and I am more than happy with what Asus delivered for the price. It does everything I need it to do - browsing, simple games, music, streaming video, Kindle Reader App, etc - and it handles most tasks smoothly enough.Some reviewers mentioned that their micro sd cards unmount randomly, but mine works great. I can access my music directly from the card using the "Play Music" app and the sound is pretty good, especially in "movie mode".The screen is bright and crisp and while I sometimes have to tap it more than once, it is generally responsive. Many online reviewers have complained about the quality and feel of the Memo Pad, but it's really not that bad. I would not even have notice the slight overlap of the back cover if it had not specifically been pointed out to me.Another common complaint is that the power button and volume rocker is in an awkward spot towards the back of the tablet. Actually, when holding the device in your left hand in the portrait position, the volume rocker is positioned perfectly to be reached with the fingers of your left hand, thus leaving your right hand free. It works equally well in the landscape position.The only negative I can think of is that Jelly Bean did not update automatically on my device to the 4.2.2 version for me yet and I am not sure how to fix this.All in all this is a very good product and the shipping from Amazon was super fast!

Reviews.Title: impressed
Reviews.Author: GTR
Reviews.Content: i own several ipads and minis, love them.ive bought the original nexus 7 and more recently a galaxy tab 2 7" - was not impressed with either relative to the ipads.all these devices seem like science fiction miracles to me, so "not impressed" is only relative to ipad standards.the memopad 7 hd arrived yesterday, and i'm very impressed!  fast performance, clear crisp screen, and android 4.2 right out of the box.  for $149 a very good value in my opinion, and viable alternative to a mini on many counts.

Reviews.Title: just love this asus table
Reviews.Author: carribbean girl
Reviews.Content: this is my first tablet and im loving every second of it. it fast and reliable and connect to WiFi very quickly. the tablet does not feel cheap to me at all. Have no problem with this item at all.

Reviews.Title: Personal Use
Reviews.Author: anthony mcdaniel
Reviews.Content: Handy little tablet, makes ease for reading headlines and notes. Books may come later, but for now the convenience of emails and news is great.

Reviews.Title: Decent performance and low price
Reviews.Author: Pikmin
Reviews.Content: ASUS Memo Pad, is targeted mainly at the low end market. With the price point of 129 for an 8gb model and 149 for the 16gb model. Which is drastically cheaper than the original Nexus 7 and the new Nexus 7. ASUS did cut the corners in all the right places in order to cheap down the cost. On the screen we have 1280x800 panel very similar to the Nexus 7 but you are not going to get that laminated look. It washes out a little easier at different angles and has an appreciable gap on the side. So it is a lower quality display but for the price it is not that bad. On the inside we have a ASUS quad core A7 1gb of ram. The performance seems snappy with Android 4.1. There are quick launch apps on the home screen with different options to launch Google now or Gmail.  So for the price 129-149 is hard to complain, it performs above that price class. It hard to recommend over the original Nexus 7 which has dip down in price if you can find one. Compare Memo Pad with other low end tablet this is the best way to go in the budget class.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: JayE
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a birthday gift for our daughter and she loves the tablet. Very easy to set up. Very responsive. Really easy to navigate. The camera is one of the best feature that our daughter likes the most. I would definitely recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: A great Android tablet, and economic too...
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: A very good purchase. I use the tablet daily, and I'm satisfied that for my surfing, email, limited online poker playing I chose well. My experience so far regarding battery life, between 6-8hrs per charge. I recommend this tablet without reservation.

Reviews.Title: So Far so Good
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Rogers
Reviews.Content: Packaging could have been better. It's literally in a box with no padding or cover over the tablet. Besides like the size and quick response. The power buttons almost seemed placed under the tablet and not alongside. Other than that for the money it's fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: R.R
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas present for my mom. She is not really a tech person and I wanted something inexpensive but still with decent specs to introduce her to tablet world. Definitely worth the price. I paid $129.99 and worth every penny. Works very smoothly. The display is crisp. Camera is great. She is really enjoying it. I am thinking about getting one for myself. I would definitely recommend for someone who is on a budget and wants a bang for their buck.

Reviews.Title: Over Charging issue
Reviews.Author: Kiarra O'Neal
Reviews.Content: In the palm size owners manual if you happen to read any of it you will find a very fine line that states "do not leave plugged up once charged memo pad 7 is not designed to stay plugged in long periods of time" try to explain that one to a responsible 6yr old. Need to put a warning label on this one "ASUS" complete waste of time

Reviews.Title: Return Xmas gift
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: It broke down after 4days  it was a Christmas gift  not very happy about it now I have to return it

Reviews.Title: Great tablet if you buy one that works.
Reviews.Author: Raymond
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet about a month ago and I had a wonderful experience with it until yesterday.  For the tablet itself has some impressive features: A colorful screen; responsive processor; high resolution(1280 x 800 for 7" tablet); good battery performance and Android 4.x.  It's compact design makes it easy to hold and it is compatible with all my other devices.  I have continuously enjoyed using it until yesterday when I plugged it to charge and it won't turn on again.  I have try using different cables and outlets, still nothing.  Based on some of the reviews I have read here, I guess it is a common problem.  I am calling ASUS support and hope they can provide me with a solution.

Reviews.Title: I bought an ASUS MEMO PAD and it never functioned
Reviews.Author: P. Lancho "patlancho"
Reviews.Content: Just I  said in the header, I bought a MEMO PAD HD 7-inch and I received it trough EPS courier, the package was unopened and sealed, then I turned on and put to charge, but it never turn on again, I write to AMAZON and they answer to me that their police it is that when you bought something with a carrier, they not replace or reimburse it. I carry the tablet to local representative of ASUS , they check it and say to me it has bad card, and the guarantee of my tablet is not valid here, because I bought it in United States. So if you live outside United States, you must be careful with this tablet because they can be a problem. I am very disappointed with ASUS because the tablet was broken and with AMAZON because they won a lot of money with people like me, in this global world, but when we have some problem, they did not assume the responsible.

Reviews.Title: BAd luck!
Reviews.Author: Jason Anstice
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of them. Played with the one for 10 mins and it shut off and will not turn on now.. not the battery.. junk

Reviews.Title: not reliable
Reviews.Author: wm.
Reviews.Content: Within 48 hrs. of getting this, the sound "broke" after a firmware update. It was barely audible and would not allow for any volume increase. "Support" (e-mail only as I couldn't find a number to call) walked me thru a factory reset, and all was fine...other than the fact that there was a great deal of frustration with pages loading. Sometimes it seemed fine, and other times very slow. Since the screen was really too small to do many of the things I wanted to do, I decided to return it. When I tried to do another factory reset, it froze up again.

Reviews.Title: Great in operation, but may have design flaw with the power
Reviews.Author: Patrick Kohler
Reviews.Content: So I really like using this tablet. It is snappy, not to much bloatware. My first one I had to send back to Amazon after a few days due to it not turning back on. My second is currently at the Asus repair center for the same problem. Not sure why it is having this problem. Otherwise it is a great tablet. Hopefully I was just unlucky to have gotten the percentage that are expected to fail. Back in my retail days, the talking point was that 10% of all electronics are dead out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Kind of disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Samantha A Tidd
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this tablet until I attempted to run Netflix. I can only get the sound, with no video, to run. I reinstalled the app several times with the same results. I have checked for system updates to get android 4.2.2, but after several attempts it still says the system is up to date (4.2.1).  I called ASUS customer support (no esay task) and they said it must be a prblem with the app.  I called Netflix customer support (only slightly easier to do) and they said the device must be defective. Typical run around.  However, I am hoping this is just a bug with this particular device. I'm going to try replacing it to see if I have the same problem with another unit. I suspect I might, but I'm giving ASUS the benefit of the doubt before seeking out another solution.

Reviews.Title: Four tries to find a tablet I liked and this is it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I tried so many tablets to get this one.  It's a good size, bigger than my beloved iPod and smaller than my husbands gargantuan tablet so it's easy to hold.  It has great internet speed and is able to show video quite well, I have no complaints.  I have even put the Dish app on here so I can watch tv on it.  The few games I play work without a hitch, photos show well and it takes decent photos, too.  I think this is one of the best tablets available and I should know, I think I bought them all!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price but not without its problems..
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This thing is really great for the price. For a basic tablet you really can't go wrong.After doing lots of reviewing I settled on this one as a gift. It turns out if you let the battery die you run the risk of it never turning back on. They seem to have a problem where it completely drains the battery and then can't take a charge. Were already on the second one, but now we are just very careful about turning it off and charging it.Great product, bad glitch in the software...

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: outdoorman
Reviews.Content: Was about to buy the Sero 7 Pro tablet when I read about the ASUS MeMo Pad HD 7.  Everything I read was pretty good and there wasnt that much of a price difference.  Well Ive had it for about a week and I'm very happy.  Granted I'm no tech guy but this works fast enough for me and I like the picture clarity and sound quality.Like it so much I began looking for an ASUS laptop to replace my old laptop that recently went out on me.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Termini
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these. No question that they are the best bang for your buck. It is fast, screen is very good. I like this better than my sons ipad. More intuitive.

Reviews.Title: easily worth the money, would buy again
Reviews.Author: Joshua Westerfield
Reviews.Content: Battery life is amazing, got it for my son for his bday and ended up giving him my note 8 instead because the battery is so good.  It came with android 4.3 and has never been updated.  The battery life is equivalent to that of an ipad mini if kot slightly better.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Town Without  Pity
Reviews.Content: I have read many, many of the comments here and made note of some of the "problems."I have had this device for over a month, and have used it almost daily.  As far as I am concerned, it's perfect for my needs.  I read on it, I play a couple of word games, watch an occasional movie, play Xfinity's On-Demand tv programs, check Facebook, Twitter and email, and visit an occasional website.  This tablet is responsive, quick, and has very good battery life.  Of course, I cannot predict what may or may not happen to it down the road, but I have had a couple of netbooks in the past that had to be shipped back to the manufacturers for repair, meaning, any device can act-up at any time.My feeling about this device vs. cost, even if it quit after 2yrs or so, I would feel I've gotten my money's worth.  I paid $149, and I honestly do not feel that's an exorbitant amount for a couple of years use from a basic tablet.  High-end and high-price, IMO, doesn't mean the device won't crash and burn.  My son just had to pay $20 to ship back an expensive Smartphone device that went completely dead just past the year's warranty, and has no idea what it's going to cost to fix it.Getting back on track, for my needs, as mentioned above, this tablet is perfect.  Fingers crossed that it will give me a couple of years of flawless use.***Adding a comment - If I am not mistaken, I remember seeing that Amazon suspended the sale of this device for a short time some months back.  I can't remember the exact wording Amazon used, but I think it had to do with the device having an issue that Amazon was addressing before putting it back on the website for sale.  That being said, I am wondering, when I see that some are reporting battery issues, this was the reason. Maybe there was a batch of devices that had faulty batteries, or some other related issue.  Any device, from any manufacturer, can have issues, I think we can all agree on that. Actually, that goes for anything, even automobiles. We just always hope we get a "good" product, without defects, that will wind up being fixed one way or the other.  I really do enjoy having this tablet.  I'm looking forward to it working flawlessly for quite a while!***

Reviews.Title: decent product, a few issues.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 of these in various colors for my wife and kids. They worked well except an issue with the sd card saying it had been removed on one of them. We sent it in and got it replaced only to get 2 in a row that were dead on arrival, stuck in a boot loop that kept crashing them. Finally got all 4 stable and running now. So other than the noticable slowness compared to my quad core samsung 10.1 tablet they are happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far, great.
Reviews.Author: A. Brown
Reviews.Content: I've had it for several months now and it's worked flawlessly.  I keep wireless off when it's not needed and the battery last for many days - even through I'm playing angry birds, reading books, and doing other things on it.  Glad I purchased....

Reviews.Title: best of best
Reviews.Author: Edgardo Vergne
Reviews.Content: Now this tablet is great.  My 6 year old use it everyday and he downloads all the free apps you can imagine and never plays them.  As much pictures of nothing he takes and this tablet still works like new.  Speed on doing what you asked is very fast and responsive.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: It has it all. A lot less finicky connecting USB compared to some tablets. Very,very few apps are not compatible. I have a leather case which can also hold my candy bar sized Bluetooth keyboard. I can boot this and do all my banking,credit,shopping, plus an amazing amount of amusement.

Reviews.Title: I'm hooked
Reviews.Author: SG
Reviews.Content: Never had a tablet, but I thought I would purchase one for an upcoming vacation out of the US - maps, restaurant recommendation, email, etc.  The phone is just too tiny for most of that stuff unless it's an emergency, but there's lots of WI-Fi where we're going and this little ASUS will do the trick.  It's very responsive, I'm not experiencing any lag as other reviewers have reported; color and clarity is phenomenal, camera does ok (NO FLASH), and having watched many a YouTube video on a particularly lazy Sunday, it seems to me this tablet has great battery life.  I purchased a sturdy, inexpensive case (Anker) which fits the tablet perfectly; it's a must have for this tablet.  I would absolutely make this purchase again.  Very happy with this little tablet.

Reviews.Title: Parental Lock
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: PLEASE HELPCan someone tell me how to get around the Parental Lock feature when you've forgotten the pass code?

Reviews.Title: Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: ProductSleuth
Reviews.Content: I have several of these units.  All have done reasonably well.  The one failure was in the auxiliary storage stick.  Upon removal, it snapped out of the unit and apparently broke the lock for the SD stick.  As it happened, this unit could be switched to the one position that  did not need additional storage.  Note: Be extremely careful in the removal of the memory stick.  If it snaps out of the slot, it can easily eject several feet from where you are.  It could also damage the SD lock.The display is clear and readable.  Battery life is several days in standby and approximately 10 hours under normal use.  There are some free apps that help in maximizing battery life by shutting down unused applications when they are unused.  I find that I use this memo pad as often as my much more expensive iPad.I would definitely recommend the purchase of a case.

Reviews.Title: Works great for my use, which is light recreational.
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah
Reviews.Content: Touchscreen is sometimes finicky, but it may work well with a stylus. Also, very susceptible to fingerprints and streaking. Display and sound are great.

Reviews.Title: A Great Deal
Reviews.Author: MrTwistoff "hobbesclarity"
Reviews.Content: My first tablet. And I am really enjoying having this. It's small enough to slide into cargo pants pockets, and quite handy to have on travel for maintaining email/Skype calls/etc. Really happy with this purchase. Perfect size - got a padded soft case for carrying it around. I do have an issue with the microSD card disconnecting a lot, need to test against another brand. Other than that no complaints. (NOTE: the micro USB connection cannot be used for a keyboard - not supported. It only serves to connect to a PC, or for charging. Important to know.) Also this did not come with a Swype Keyboard, so I will probably by an app for it - otherwise typing emails is slow (although the predictive word generator is pretty good at learning words I use).

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for little money
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet for the price. Make sure you install the system update right after getting through the Android setup procedure or it may start coming up with exceptions. Also, the screen is not ridged like other tablets so be careful on cleaning the screen. I think I broke the screens touch sensors in my first one by pressing too hard cleaning the screen. Many people say get a screen protector for it and I think that is wise advise.Has lots of power. Lasts a long time on a battery charge.great wireless capabilities (no NFC). And get a 32 gb flash card to store your data on.

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: Victoria R.
Reviews.Content: I like the tablet,  it is very easy to use.  It downloads fast, I can connect to wifi in different locations and feel safe using it.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The basic functions like screen resolution and response are better than expected. The user interface is easy to use and videos play very well. I would recommend this tablet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: This is quite functional for trips when I do not wish to carry my laptop!
Reviews.Author: Doctor Anne
Reviews.Content: Pros:Cost! This is a good deal. Much less expensive than a iPAD miniGreat Kindle-substitute, in color.Small and lightweight-fits in all but the smallest of my pursesI can check my email, facebook, and weather on it.Good camera!Cons:considering the price, noneDifficult to type long messages, but that is true of any pad

Reviews.Title: Great tablet value!
Reviews.Author: Amy C.
Reviews.Content: For the money this has to be the best tablet you can buy. If you do research online it has a good reliability rating and a high battery life rating compared to other tablets. I can attest to both, and I go days without charging the battery, depending on how often I use it. Hours and hours and hours of gameplay!  Graphics are good too.  Plus it's android, so you get a lot more free apps and don't have to worry about conforming to the standards of Apple or other tablet devices.

Reviews.Title: Love this
Reviews.Author: Kellie S. Lively
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet! Responds very well to touch and holds a charge forever! Great pic and def worth the money! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Premium isn't expensive anymore
Reviews.Author: Anonynja
Reviews.Content: Helluva capable tablet. It just does everything well! Such a pleasant surprise in technology- no nuisances to speak of. I only use it lightly, so I won't attest to its durability, but usability is simply great. Frankly, I feel spoiled for being a child of this generation, with a relatively cheap device that does.. so.. much. Movies, games, browsing, navigating, music, organizing, corresponding, pictures, you know the drill. Companies don't even bothering listing all the features and programs tablets come with, haha. My point is that this tablet handles *all* of them. The hardware is perfectly adequate; I've experienced no lag in any setting.And the size is just perfect! I love reading with it, and it's big enough to watch a movie on the bus or whatever, yet compact enough to comfortably hold in one hand and fit into any bag. 7" is such a sweet spot, though it ain't much of a drawing surface (unless you usually draw in little notepads for some reason).I just want to emphasize that i have *no complaints* with this tablet whatsoever. None. Now I'm pretty zen and not particularly picky, but seriously, nothing about the memopad annoys me. It has so far simply been a positive addition to my life. I'll end on that note :)

Reviews.Title: Carry It Everywhere!
Reviews.Author: Puff Kitty
Reviews.Content: This little ASUS MeMO is great.  The colors, the definition - fine!  The camera is good, surprise!  It is easy to use as a calendar, the Kindle android app works great on it, easier than on the paperwhite kindle (it even looks as good as the Fire to me). The speakers are tinny, but of course you can add a speaker via the USB and earphone ports.  Music sounds good enough to enjoy and audio books too.  Am not a gamer so cannot speak to that.  It is easy to navigate, which is the most important.  Bought a Roo Case for it which protects the screen since it did NOT come with a plastic screen protector like you would expect! Listen up, ASUS people!  After almost six months, my only complaint is that the battery runs down quickly, moreso than when new.  If you are on the Internet, it is sapped within a few hours.  If you are just reading, maybe it will last a day.  It now needs to be plugged in each night.  Would be interesting to know if other owners of this device are experiencing the same thing.  Over all, I am satisfied w/ the tablet and the price.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable value and performance for an entry level "REAL" tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this on sale for my eleven year old back in November 2013 for $119.xx and couldn't be happier with the purchase!  Very durable, fluid, powerful for the price, etc...  Looked at SOOOOO many tablets before making this decision.  EVERYTHING cheaper was just that...terrible screen, slow processing ability, no sd slot, on and on...  Anything that was even CLOSE the regular price of this tablet ($149.xx) couldn't match it's performance specs.  Nexus was closest and considerably more expensive.  Samsung Tab 3 was decently more expensive but couldn't touch the power of this tab in direct side-by-side comparison at local stores.Again, very pleased!!!  So much, in fact, that Santa brought his nine year old sister one for X-mas and, of course, she loves it too!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet
Reviews.Author: wanda ingram
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and the Asus had good reviews so I bought it. For the $150 price its a pretty good tablet. The only complaint I have is it doesnt take great pictures on the inside but very good pictures on the outside. The body is very durable and not cheap looking. I wish the volume was a little louder for Pandora but I guess I need a stereo if I want loud music..Im satisfied with my purchse!

Reviews.Title: So far so good... Edited 4/29/2013--UGH
Reviews.Author: Mama of 4
Reviews.Content: ***Edited 4/29/14: Well, I had a feeling this would happen. We now are sending out the second tablet we purchased. The keypad function suddenly stopped working. These tablets are well taken care of. They are screen and tablet protected completely and my sons are monitored in their usage of them. I am beside myself that both of these tablets after only four months of usage needed to be serviced already. That is absurd. I have a feeling this will be happening again. I'm happy that the company is willing to fix the issue, but to have to pay to ship to them, then my sons losing all of their info and games and such, it's just quite a pain to deal with this. Why can't they just work properly? I find it hard to believe that these are solid, well built tablets when in purchasing two of them, I've already needed them BOTH serviced after such a short period of use. I'm staring to believe they are junk tablets. Yea, the price wasn't $300 but we did pay $129 for each tablet and for a family on a budget, that isn't cheap to us! I expected more out of these and am feeling let down by the whole brand itself. Such a bummer. :/My advice is that if you have ANY issue that cannot be resolved, contact the company through a live chat. They will work with you on what is the problem and will need all of your info on the tablet itself. They then create an RMA for you to fill out and send with the tablet to Texas for servicing. You have to pay the shipping, but they pay for it on the way back to you. Anyway, good luck to those that own this! Another two cents...if you're considering these tablets...don't!Bought two of these for Christmas as a gift to each of my sons, who at the time were 6 and 7. One of them suddenly stopped working recently and we contacted the company directly, in which we live chatted with someone on the issue. After trouble shooting some things, we realized we weren't getting anywhere and the company then sent us a form through an email so we could pack up the tablet and send it to them so it could be checked and fixed if possible. Within two weeks we got the tablet back, just like new. We lost everything as far as what was downloaded game wise (as that's all they play on their tablets) but we expected that and it was not a problem whatsoever as all the games were just free downloads. We had to pay nothing (except shipping TO them, which I was fine with because we just wanted the problem resolved) and had the tablet back so fast that it was just a very simple process overall. With that, I am very satisfied. The company came through on that retrospect fully.The only issue I have is that they never said what the problem was directly, and that is something I would have liked to have known. I don't understand why that is, but I think they could have least told us what was wrong and possibly why. But we got it back fixed and I'm happy with that. So far, so good. We'll see how these hold up in the future. At least I know I can turn to the company for help when needed as they did come through the first time around. I fully back up going through them if you didn't purchase a warranty through Amazon, and especially if you are after the time frame through Amazon as well. Do not go through what's listed in your booklets...I had to google the company and choose United States to get with someone here. They are located in Texas. Any issues, I highly recommend that you try the company first and foremost.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: It replaced my old laptop. It's so lightweight and cute. Plus it's super fast and it's the perfect size for reading, playing games, web surfing, etc.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch Pad for basic function
Reviews.Author: Dan J. McClellan
Reviews.Content: Responsive, charge lasts good.  Perfect for multifunction tab - toddler education, social media, news, any other apps.  Very high quality device - especially for low price.

Reviews.Title: Asus 7 HD.
Reviews.Author: Jack Caldicott
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with it. Works great with a lot of useful built in applications. Exceeded my expectations.Really great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: R. Marcela
Reviews.Content: Practical, eficient, great price, great size. It was a gift for the kid and he loves it. Battery life es exceptional and the processor takes all the gaming he does great. Is also great for reading books and watching movies because of the hd screen!

Reviews.Title: Got It For The Wife, She Likes It
Reviews.Author: N. L.
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife.  I configured it and added some apps for her.  So far she's been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!  But a few issues (see updates)
Reviews.Author: Eduarrdo Nietzsche
Reviews.Content: I have resisted getting a tablet for a long time because I already have an excellent 11.6" Thinkpad mini-laptop for portable use plus a very capable Android smartphone, in addition to a full sized laptop for home/work use, and couldn't imagine any extra functionality that a tablet could possibly provide.Well, until it dawned upon me that rather than waking one of my laptops up from sleep throughout the day to check email, Facebook, news, weather, calendar or to-do lists, I could simply do that on something bigger than my smartphone, which would severely cut down on the battery wear and tear of the smartphone as well as the overall wear and tear of my laptops.At the same time, I was reluctant to plop down $300-500 for one of the premium-level tablets (and definitely not an iPad, since I hate Apple products on principle as well as from experience). That basically left the Google Nexus 7 as the best bang-for-the-buck option, but I was annoyed at its lack of a microSD card slot since I anticipated using the tablet to play music through my car stereo's AUX input during cross country travels.The Asus MemoPad HD 7 pretty much does everything I really need it to do, and at an amazing pricepoint: my local computer geek chain shop had it for a hundred bucks (it's the "Lite" version which has 8GB instead of 16GB of onboard storage, which is irrelevant unless you intend to download tons of games and apps), and I found an open-box one for eighty...truly an offer I couldn't refuse.And am very happy with it so far. It has a relatively limited amount of manufacturer-installed bloatware that cannot be removed or disabled (unlike my girlfriend's Samsung smartphone, which is full of Samsung's proprietary crapware), the 4-core processor (mine has a MediaTek not an "Intel Celeron" as Amazon lists here) and 1GB of RAM that provides a pleasantly snappy user experience, the screen is plenty bright and sharp for my needs (I honestly couldn't see a huge difference with the new Nexus 7's supposedly state-of-the-art display), the battery life is decent...no complaints, really. Caveats: I have a TomTom standalone GPS in my car that I'm very happy with so I can't comment on how GPS navigation works on this thing, and I am not a gamer at all so my graphics/speed requirements are modest at best.One unexpected BIG happy surprise: even though Asus officially says that this tablet only accepts a maximum of 32GB microSD card, it works perfectly fine with my SanDisk 64GB SDXC card! From what I've found via googling, Asus is legally obligated to claim a 32GB max because Microsoft owns the "SDXC" patent/copyright and would demand a heft licensing fee for mentioning its compatibility. Or something to that effect (I'm no lawyer, heh). Anyway, 64GB is ample room for all the music (and video) you could want to take with you.Sure, the back of the casing is a slippery and slightly chintzy plastic that doesn't sit level due to the curious protrusion around the rear camera lens, but hey that's easily taken care of with a seven dollar case that I ordered (you'd be stupid to use a tablet without a case, anyhow).My only niggly complaint is that the capacitative touch screen is not quite as precise and consistent as I would like...about 25% of the time, more than one tap may be needed. This I'm willing to live with, considering the price and overall usefulness of this device!UPDATE 3/26/2014:Have noticed that various malfunctions pop up whenever the tablet is not being held flat on a table, desk, or generally in a stable downward-pressing position. Specifically, using it while supine in bed = a nightmare of missed keystrokes, unresponsive touchscreen presses, random predictive-typing choices automatically chosen for you, the screen auto-rotate going bonkers (I just gave up and turned off the darn feature), the microSD card somehow becoming dislodged such that the tablet thinks you've manually ejected it without electronically unmounting it first---and on and on!  Unless this is a problem universal to all tablets, my guess is that the innards of this device are not securely held together tightly enough, probably part of the cost-cutting measures that resulted in this tablet costing under half that of its higher-end clone, the Nexus 7.  Sigh...it's not a dealbreaker given the price, but it does merit me reducing my rating from 5 to 4 stars.  Just hope that this is not a harbinger of more serious mechanical/hardware breakdowns to come...perhaps I should spring for that Square Trade warranty after all.UDPATE 4/4/2014:The microSDXC card dismounting by itself is becoming a more frequent problem, not limited to only supine use.  This is a HUGE disappointment, since the card slot was the main attraction for buying this darn thing to begin with.  Reduced rating to 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: My E-Reader
Reviews.Author: Theresa Chapman
Reviews.Content: I use this as my E-Reader. I play games from time to time or use it to read recipes but mainly as a reader. Love it. Device is easy to load books onto and read in the Kindle App. I love that can wave up or down to change the brightness. The battery saver is awesome and last a long time when WiFi is off.

Reviews.Title: Has Problems
Reviews.Author: JUST-JIM
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem wih this is the inability to play  3rd party apps and games. They will load but when you hit play it dont. This is a big problem as this was to be a gift. Im going to contact Asus ( I hear thats an exercise in futiity) and see what they say. If its a no no, back it goes for a different brand. By the way-Their support site really sucks. They cant find this model. WTF?

Reviews.Title: my son loves it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect tablet for my 7 year old son. Not slow, not too big, he uses it daily.

Reviews.Title: Power
Reviews.Author: Debra L. Stover "debra6502"
Reviews.Content: When I got my Asus, I was like yeah it will be slow like the old tablet I had, but it wowed me right out of the package. This device has more speed and functions than my desktop computer. It glides smoothly, has no problem multi tasking, there is no Wait time. you got it when you want it. I was able to watch movies, play games, get e-mail, and with a few apps place and receive phone calls.Took it to my sons asked him for his wifi password, logged into it and watched a movie while i was there, then when I went back home it had changed wifi accounts seamlessly, wowed me again. I would highly recommend this tablet  to anyone...it is great. The digital cameras are the best that I have had, but I am new to the dig cam world. Would I buy an ASUS again,...yes I would.

Reviews.Title: Great tab but I can't move apps to external SD.
Reviews.Author: Adult Star
Reviews.Content: The best quad core gadget for the price vs specs. Does anyone know how to move apps to micro SD?

Reviews.Title: Great Little Wonder
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something small, light, with basics and a camera and this little fellow has it all plus some great features. It's the perfect little tablet, not too much not to little. This is exactly what I was looking for, it's easy to understand and uncomplicated, but yet sophisticated and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Asus Memopad
Reviews.Author: Marguarita Lopez
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying the Asus pad as I am able to take pictures and use it in my car. I am finding more ways to use it in my every day life.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Cassie Drevniak
Reviews.Content: excellent tablet at a great price. purchased in pink and love the color.  have experienced zero problems with this product. would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Good value for price
Reviews.Author: M. Ondich "MelLO"
Reviews.Content: I bought two; one for my daughter, and one for me.  I think she's permanently attached to it.  She has been playing The Sims a lot, as well as other games and has not complained of any issues.  Battery life is amazingly long for what I've seen in tablets.  I don't use mine a lot and will last several days while turned on, but locked. I was surprised to pick it up almost two weeks later and still have 30% battery left.My daughter charges hers every night, but it lasts several hours on weekends when she is off and on all day.  YouTube, Netflix, etc looks good.  The screen is crisp and clear.  Typical Android device, but I do miss the Swype technology my Samsung phone has.The screen does seem to have a little tiny lag or delayed reaction.  I'm used to my Galaxy S4 which just does things immediately when touched, this I have to pause for a split second on each touch to get it to register.  Irritating when you're highly impatient like I am.  And there seems to be some weird error that happens, if I back out of a screen I seem to get stuck in a loop of an error stating something has stopped.  It doesn't happen all the time, and I find if I just hit the home screen then run a task kill it doesn't happen.  But so far my only complaints.

Reviews.Title: Nice buy!
Reviews.Author: tyler
Reviews.Content: I've had this only for a day so I may change my mind later but so far so good. I had to download an app to play movies, I feel this should already be on the tablet. I like that it's easy enough for a two year old to use, even though the screen is a bit smaller than expected (might be an issue). Still checking it out though.

Reviews.Title: Nice handy tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Manternach
Reviews.Content: I got the Asus MemoPad for the kids for Christmas.  It has been a good product.  The only issue is battery life, and it is very slow to come on (one might have to hold the on button for more than 10 seconds for a power up).  It does not have a swype capable keyboard installed which is annoying once you come to expect it in a device.  Otherwise, it is fast, perfectly sized, and fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Nexus at an inexpensive price?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My friend has a Nexus and I researched information noting that Asus is a manufacturer of that tablet, so I took a chance at this more generic one. (I am NOT a technologically savvy person.) Being the owner of a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, as well as having messed around with my friend's tablets from other brands, is the only credibility I have when I say that this tablet is amazing. For a prices that is less expensive than a Galaxy, I get great camera shots (Galaxy disappointed me with this when I first owned one) with what is apparently 5 MP (although the front-facing camera is only 1.5 MP), and the speed of this tablet is impressive. Also, I do not have to worry much about the battery life. Those who own a Galaxy will know that at some point throughout an eight-hour day a worry will sink in about whether or not to plug in our tablet. This (Asus) tablet actually makes me feel secure not only about not plugging in the battery, but about not having to wait long for it to recharge once it does require to be plugged-in to an outlet. Wow. The battery (again, not a technologically savvy person) charges quickly and lasts probably more than the 10 hours noted on the product description. I am noticing that I can go on and on about this product, so I will only say this: buy it. It made me happy and will likely make others like me happy as well. (Note: I was worried about reviews concerning glitches on this device. After a week of ownership, I think I know what that is about. It is not that this device has glitches, but that it is very rigid in the way its features function. For example, I have noticed that I have to reopen my setting app if I choose to unpair a device through a bluetooth connection. However, for the price and great features that come with that price, one can easily adapt to this extra step in the process.)Thanks Asus!

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: ananthalakshmi
Reviews.Content: Good for through price I guessGiving lite troubleStill getting good in a whileI am OK with the product.

Reviews.Title: Extremely satisfied
Reviews.Author: JON E SHORT
Reviews.Content: We bought this tablet for our 6 year old daughter. It is perfect for her! The Play Store is exactly like the Play Store on the Android phones which is perfect bc she was able to download all of the apps she was already familiar with from my phone. Camera takes great pics! This is an exceptional tablet at a low cost.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, great price
Reviews.Author: collegekidd16
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great. Picture is great, camera is great, love that you can expand the storage, very few glitches, and a great size. Sound could be louder and the back gets scratched quickly, so make sure you buy a case.

Reviews.Title: Sokid tsblet for 150$
Reviews.Author: Valeren
Reviews.Content: I have had product for 3 weeks, although I did not purchase on amazon i did get a (returned) pad from the store. In simple words the tablet is exactly what i needed. I have a tf300t and its has worked very well with minmal issues for 2 years and the memo hd was its perfect companion.  The main pupose of the tablet was for flying and being able to look at approach plates and maps. However because of screen resolution and overall solid performance of tablet ill probably use it for more. The gps works very well even at 27k feet. I would recommend to others but looking at other reviews the warranty might be a good option.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Mid-Priced Tablet
Reviews.Author: Al G
Reviews.Content: Great bang for the buck!  I wanted a capable tablet with good specs that would serve my needs.  This tablet has a lot of higher priced features in a Mid-price range.  It has a Quad Core 1.2 GHz processor, 16 GB Flash Memory, 1 GB RAM Memory with a 10-hour battery life.  It also has a 5MP rear camera and a 1.2 MP front.  A lot tablets don't have any rear facing camera at all, especially within this price range!  It has built in WIFI which means you can connect to WIFI when available and then don't have the ongoing charges from a wireless carrier to deal with. The screen is also a respectable 1280 x 800 resolution which means the colors will pop and you don't go blind trying to read anything with it, especially a book.It's updates have been to Android Jelly Bean 4.2.2.  Hopeful Asus will make available and release updates to Android 4.4.2 soon.  An entry level tablet can leave you wanting more and a premium price of $400 will make you poor but this tablet is respectable for all but the super power user.  It's 16GB memory is fairly large but if you need more it can be expanded with a SD memory card for massive music or pictures storage.  And with Cloud Storages available you may prefer to use that for access from multiple devices.  With access to "Google Play" you can have hundreds of thousands of free apps to choose from and make your tablet do what ever you like.  Can't go wrong with this tablet, a great value from a respected manufacturer!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Vinny
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet for Christmas 2013, and I absolutely love it every single day. Connection to WiFi networks in terms of bandwidth effectively doubled from what my phone can do. Handles Madden 25 Mobile without any lag at all (To give you an idea of what this tablet can do in terms of gaming), and has an absolutely beautiful display! I use it for everything, work, play, study, and it has yet to give me any problems!!! The only way for you to truly understand what I am saying...buy one! :)

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for organization!
Reviews.Author: David Galli
Reviews.Content: Great device for work! Has everything you need to get organized because everything syncs to Google. I docked 1 star for the stock apps that are installed which can't be removed. If you are considering a tablet, this is a great tablet at a great price. Plenty of space with the extra MicroSD card (sold separately). The only issue is you cannot move apps to the SD. Only personal files and pictures or videos. All-in-all, a great little tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Polzin
Reviews.Content: I have old HP touchpad tablet si converted to android.  ASUS works muc smoother.  7" size is convenient to carry more like a paperback book.  e readers including Kindle work great.  Can display movies fine.  Some website do not work because Android no longer supports flash player.by ADOBE.  The softkeys at bottom are great.  Good display and like to backup to an SDCARD.  Best bang for buck in the 7" tablets with Android.

Reviews.Title: This is what I have been waiting for.
Reviews.Author: Michael "Mikehattan"
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find.....I cannot recommend this underestimated little gem enough.I welcome and value this very worthwhile addition between my communication devices.

Reviews.Title: I am so happy with this item
Reviews.Author: Lyneigh
Reviews.Content: The tablet works great, excellent picture and sound quality as well, I would recommend this to anyone, this is everything I wanted from a tablet and more

Reviews.Title: the volume level is low
Reviews.Author: Robert Krzyzanowski
Reviews.Content: I show a lot of video clips from JW.ORG that I've downloaded and find that if there is any noise in the area that the video is hard to hear.  all is well when all is quiet but I really am disappointed in not being able to get a good sound.  my husband has the same pad in navy and his sound is a little stronger. there is no app to make it louder. im ready to resell and pick up a better brand.

Reviews.Title: Southerxside
Reviews.Author: Jesus rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Price is really good. I bought it for my 2 year old daughter it lags a little bit but above all i like it.

Reviews.Title: Quality Tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: RICARDO I JAMES
Reviews.Content: Nice quality tablet for the price, no problems thus far. Nice neat size, Asus made it to be quite functional and allows good multitasking. For example if u need a calc app to run on top of another app currently in use.

Reviews.Title: great tablet , i fully recomended
Reviews.Author: green
Reviews.Content: Was skeptic because of the price , i get the memo pad 16gb its been almost 3 months since i bought it , and still i don't see a downside, it's fast great sound, HD video quality, light weight, bottom line i love this device.  Small detail the shell creeks sometimes material quality is standard might feel low quality, but fear not the device wont break in your hands and that comes from a 240 pounds man.

Reviews.Title: the most cost-effective tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this is the third asus tablet, i really enjoy it (watching kindle book, movies and games) without any issues for 3 month.i recommend protective film and case for this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kenyada Henderson
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my husband for Christmas and he LOVES it, it is always attached to his hand. He especially loves the dual cameras. I also own an Asus laptop that is over 4 years old and still works wonderfully; this is a reliable brand that I trust, which is why I chose this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best Entry Tablet
Reviews.Author: Steven L. Bledsoe "RC Jet Freak"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before picking up 2 of these. I was getting tablets for my 9yo twins, so I was looking at price, durability, and something that they could grow with. I didn't want to by some child specific built tablet which some were even higher priced than the ASUS or the cheaper ones that didn't get very good reviews. In my weeks of research it became evident that the best bang for the buck for this size entry level tablet was between this and the Nexus 7. Both have their pros and cons but they are pretty close in comparison. Everything will tell you the Nexus 7(newer model) is best but it will cost you more too. They said the new ASUS MEMO HD was closely designed to the previous Nexus 7. For me it was not worth the price difference since this was going to be for my kids first tablets. These also had the sd card expansion the Nexus does not. We have had these for about a month and they are used non-stop by my boys. If you are used to using and android based smart phones you will have a easy learning curve in setting up and using these tablets. It runs fast. We have had no issues with internet or running games. My boys run Netflix constantly and there has been no lag. This also has a front and rear camera with decent quality. I set them up with Skype accounts so they can video chat with the grandparents anytime they want. Looked good on our end and my parents said the picture on their end was good too. I find myself grabbing their tablets a lot to use vs. my laptop or cell phone now. I think the viewer angles are good. The only "con" I can see as noted by others is this unit does show finger prints easily. But that is only a issue depending on how the light hits it and come on, how hard is it to just wipe it off. They do sell screen protectors for this that helps with this issue, but honestly ours is in a case and I always tell the boys to wash there hands before they use them. Battery life is really good. My boys can use them almost non-stop playing games, streaming movies, internet, etc. and it would be at 20-30% battery life. This has parent control features but I have not set them up. This is a good entry level tablet and perfect size for portability. Will fit in your purse with a case easily ladies. We bought the Procase ASUS MeMO Pad HD Protective case here on Amazon which fit perfect and are very durable( Also come with free stylus). If you been looking at this tablet or want a good entry level tablet this is it. I honestly don't know why anyone would need to spend 300+ for a tablet. If your one of those people who can do everything from their phone but just would like to have a bigger screen to look at then this is your answer. Were happy, and we got 2 for less than 1 in the higher end models. This is perfect for those of us on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: Awesome Tablet for the money. Bought it as a gift for my mother after almost pulling the trigger on the slightly more expensive Nexus 7 (2013). Saved a bit of money on this and it's absolutely perfect for her needs. Great size/weight, good screen, and works flawlessly so far. Highly recommended if you're in the market for a 7inch tablet.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: the kids love these tablets they work great and are way better then the last ones we got them these things are fast and work great no issues yet.

Reviews.Title: More than expected
Reviews.Author: Carolyn P. Woods
Reviews.Content: I have found this to be satisfactory in every way.  I selected this particular one based on other reviews from customers.

Reviews.Title: It worked great for 6 weeks
Reviews.Author: Kimberly74
Reviews.Content: This seems like a great little tablet for the money while it works. It was purchased as a Christmas present for my son in an effort to wrestle back control of my iPad. Unfortunately for me most of his favorite toddler apps (Endless ABCs and a few others) were not available on this version and he still preferred mine. While it worked I thought it was user friendly and pretty intuitive. It received fairly light use for 4-6 weeks and then suddenly went to sleep and will now no longer turn on. The battery was fully charged at the time and additional charging does not help. I purchased an additional warranty, but it looks like I may have to contact the manufacturer according to other reviews. Had I known this would happen I probably would have held off buying a tablet or purchased an iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas and it has been performing great so far.  Battery last a long time, apps load quick, lots of power for a low price (caught mine for $120), well worth the price I paid for a mid-tier tablet to mess around with.

Reviews.Title: I like this tablet
Reviews.Author: Ronny B.
Reviews.Content: It is much faster than my 8 inch tablet I have from Vizio, but I think it is only a single core processor where this one is a quad-core.  I bought a winshield mount for it and I use it with Co-Pilot for my GPS and for playing my MP3s, at the same time.  I have 1995 Pontaic Trans Am that has a OEM cassette player, but with and Aux Jack added so this plugs right into it with an double 1/8" stereo phone jack.  I also use it to play games and view pictures and videos from my Canon camera.BTW the mount I bought was from Amazon also the "Jarv High Grade Windshield Swivel Suction Car Mount for Google Nexus 7 / Apple Ipad Mini, Ipad Mini 2 / Galaxy Tab 2 , Tab 3 and All 7 Inch Tablets" and it works get with this tablet for me.

Reviews.Title: ASUS  Memo Pad HD 7 in.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love it. I researched tablets for about 2 weeks then decided on this one. 16 GB Quadcore. I got the 7 inch one for the convenience of mobility ( it fits in cargo pants pocket,and in my inside jacket pockets). I have talked others into getting one also. This I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I'd buy it again
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Great device, runs smoothly, and handles what I need for personal or business use. Great battery life and great screen resolution.  Really needed a matte finish screen protector and is sadly a very skinny tablet compared to other 7" tablets. Super buy for the price!!!!

Reviews.Title: Surprising!
Reviews.Author: Billo
Reviews.Content: It was indeed surprising. My wife has wanted a small tablet for over a year so we followed the recommendation of a friend. We studied the reviews and this model scored higher than most. It was a good fit for her needs. She uses it for her email, some web browsing and viewing movies and videos anywhere in the house. She's extremely pleased. Color is great, sound is more than adequate and battery life is good. She's recommended it to three of her friends and one has already purchased one. Wish it came with some cheapo basic case but for the price it was a real bargain. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: It's the best tablet at this price that I ever seen. Works perfect, it's very fast and it has an excelent performance with games and apps. Reaaly good style.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: Janneth
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my niece as a Christmas gift. She is eleven years old and this is her first tablet. I looked at cheaper tablets, but this tablet has good specs, reviews, and Bluetooth. She was able to get a Bluetooth keyboard to do her homework. I paid $129 for the tablet, which is not a bad price for a dependable brand and sturdy tablet. My niece uses it everyday and she loves it! She has not encountered any issues.

Reviews.Title: Good old Android Operating System but much faster
Reviews.Author: kevin "Old HP Guy"
Reviews.Content: As an owner of a first generation Nexus 7 from December 2012,I can certainly recommend this MemoPad by Asus. It has virtually the same screen setup as before so it has been a snap for me to get all my software installed and all the other accounts that I use. What is really nice is the much faster processor speed. I don't have to wait around for programs to load and for data to download. I am VERY pleased with this unit and frankly, for what it does, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent bargin for the price
Reviews.Author: W. Wallace
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter a month ago and she loves it. The screen has good color, battery charge holds well and we haven't had a single problem with it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Trismegistus "Trismegistus"
Reviews.Content: Bought several different tablets on Amazon, have reviewed most of them.This is a great tablet, on par with the similarly-priced Galaxy Tab series. All it lacks is the Tab's IR remote capabilities, and it has a much better charger than the Galaxy's, which is known to be a problem the manufacturer has yet to correct, Out of the tabets I have purchased here on Amazon, dollar-for-dollar this has been the best buy, and I continue to use it every day for email, games, surfing the web, and it has yet to fail me. If I just check my email, play an hour or so of games, maybe surf an hour or so each day, I can go almost 3 days without a charge. The actual uptime on a full charge with constant active use (i.e. playing something) for me has been about 8 hours. if I just check my email and do little else, I can go days.In sum, if you want a top of the line tablet at a good price, one that has an expansion slot for more space, and dual cameras, with an HD screen, and even a transcover (close the optional case cover and it sends your tablet to sleep, saving power), you can't, in my opinion, do any better than this Asus Memopad HD. A great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Jay White
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tablet that does everything I need. Couldn't be happier. I would recommend a matt finish screen protector, the ASUS Transcover and a 32 GB micro SD card -- you'll be all set.

Reviews.Title: a great device
Reviews.Author: tony fishman
Reviews.Content: it a really good tablet I use it all the time to get to the internet carry it everywhere good price good deal what can I say

Reviews.Title: Nice device
Reviews.Author: Dktom
Reviews.Content: Works well, I bought it for my son and he really enjoys using it. I like that you can expand the storage.

Reviews.Title: review for Asus tablet
Reviews.Author: dgd
Reviews.Content: My daughter likes this tablet, but it did not come in blue. Otherwise no complaints yet.I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: A great buy for the price!
Reviews.Author: Zamobafood
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son to reclaim my iPad. I was very impressed by the build quality. It feels heavy but it's solid.Performance is great for the many games he plays. With numerous apps opened in the background it runs sooth and without hesitation. The included app locker is great for children. You can select any app to require a password to use.The only negative is the some what awkward position of the lock button. It's reseed on the right side under a lip and sometimes hard to find with a rubber skin installed.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Gary Patton
Reviews.Content: My first tablet and getting to know it is fun. It fits the hand well and isn't heavy. Right now it is worth 5 stars for me. It is what I expected

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Sonja Capell
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet 3 months ago and it is wonderful!  No problems, no complaints!  Will buy this brand again!

Reviews.Title: Great price and works well!
Reviews.Author: Amanda N. Grell
Reviews.Content: We ordered this as a replacement for another tablet that we had gotten for my 8 year old daughter for Christmas. The original tablet was a Latte Ice Quad-Core 7" tablet and it ceased to work after one week of light use. However, we thought this would be a nice upgrade to that with a good reputation. My daughter loves it! Not only is it a bright pink which makes her feel pretty special in comparison to her older brother's Samsung Galaxy tab (white), but it is the perfect mix of style and function. She originally wanted an Ipad Mini but after receiving this tablet, she has not made a peep about any other tablets. The cameras work well and give good images which was an important thing for her. The screen has good resolution and everything works well with a light touch. She spends her time on the tablet using various game apps and youtube. I have to say after our first experience ordering the Latte tablet, this tablet has been a real treat!

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: swapiney
Reviews.Content: The plastic back worried me but so far so good! Very happy with my memopad. I did extensive research and found this was the best tab for the money! :-)

Reviews.Title: great overall
Reviews.Author: Leonie Wallace
Reviews.Content: So far has been good with all games my son has played, seems fast no freezes or glitches great to read books and comics really vivid colors overall very satisfied and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Works well for almost everything
Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: Our first tablet, and happy to have it as an addition to our XP netbook, Win7 laptop and Android phone. Have only used the tablet on home wi-fi but it is very responsive and the display is much sharper  and richer than the older netbook and phone. I would give it 5 stars but the lack of flash capability on Android s/w, means that I am unable to watch all the a/v (on news or sport sites for example) that I can with the WinOS devices. Secondly I had a scare when it appeared to die on me, when the battery ran down, however by charging it every evening, I haven't had this happen again.I would buy ASUS again.

Reviews.Title: I  am happy with my table ASUS MeMoPad
Reviews.Author: Alejandra
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my board I think I made a good buy because it appropriate to my limited this new technology knowledge, and what I like is that the battery saving is wonderful, good screen size and I can watch my favorite channels, and my email, Facebook and many more besides, I'm very happy with my purchase I recommend the seller as I arrived in the estimated time and highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: michelle kar
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet worth the price. It's just like my phone only bigger, great battery life, great to take on the go!!Would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: EYEz
Reviews.Content: Pros-small perfect size-clear image-durable-battery life-user friendlyCons- you lose sense of time-when someone talks to you you never hear what they say because you are to into your new tabletThis is my first tablet and i bought one around October of 2013 and my brother wanted one to so i got him one for the holidays its great for checking emails and surfing the internet/typing up documents on the fly. you need a wifi connection so you can't bring it everywhere but i bought a 32gb SDcard that i have a bunch of music and movies so its perfect for traveling. the color selection is kind of lame but get a good cover and you are set. Its a very bright screen. You get glares from time to time when there is a lot of light in the room so get a MATTE screen protector not a CLEAR and your problem is solved. It has so many features i usually end up finding new ones everyday. i only play slow casual games so i don't no about how good it runs with all the fancy games. Movies look really good on this and it can fit in the back of your jeans if you don't feel like carrying it around. Books on this are great perfect for the bookworm or college student plus most books are a lot cheaper when they are digital!If your into Graphic novels this is very good to the picture color is great overall a must buy for the cheaper but not rip off cheap. Delivery was perfect so no problems there.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: GH "Ross"
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it and I sneak it away and play with it too.  We know nothing about tablets but the long lasting battery lets us mess with it to learn as we go.  Great looking and pretty darn good speakers too.

Reviews.Title: great asus tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: at this price, you cannot go wrong.its fast and responsive.smoothe to the touch. don't wait and go buy now! thank you

Reviews.Title: We love Asus !
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Best tablets on the market. No sense spending more and getting less! These tablets work great and are well built.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7's Sister Is Ok
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
