Now does not that make it is very expensive to send it back to the U.S. again.

Reviews.Title: build quality, plastic screen. manufacturing defects make me want to return it., get Dell venue 7 instead
Reviews.Author: Mitchell B. Fox
Reviews.Content: I have only had it for a few days, and have not had much time to really run it through its paces yet, but I am most likely going to return it. The display, especially. in regard to video, does seem really good. I have not found the device to be generally laggy so far, although I haven't really used it with many apps, under significant "load." My real complaint is with what I saw in some other reviews and was concerned about, the build, fit and finish and overall quality. it does seem creaky, the screen does seem like it is made from plastic, and the one I got had a little glue in the seam between the screen and the rest of the body. That seem seems to be of uneven width around the device and most likely will get other gunk caught in it. I really haven't had a chance to see if it has problems or works well with various apps, but will probably return it. I have ordered, believe it or not, a Dell venue 7, which has 1gb more internal memory, a decent (from what I have read) processor, and an equivalent screen. It runs stock android and is right now at 4.2 (like the asus), rather than 4.3, I think. And it is at a similar price point.

Reviews.Title: Well
Reviews.Author: Travis R. Cole "T.Cole"
Reviews.Content: I am only giving it two stars because it seemed nice for the one day before it died. The speed seemed comparable to my Samsung galaxy s3 and the wifi worked significantly better. But as the story goes I had the tablet for two days before it wouldn't turn on. The tablet after being fully charged earlier that day was at 75% when I went to bed. Tried to turn it on in the morning and nothing. I thought maybe the battery was dead so put it to charge and tried it later. Nothing. Did the 60 second power button push and nothing. Tried charging again through the computer and nothing. End story it never turned back on. Sent it back to Amazon and waiting for a refund.I thought I would add some additional info. I did like the asus additions to the andriod OS. There is a battery monitoring app and also an app usage that can be used to kill idling apps to free up memory.  However the night before my tablet died it downloaded and installed a new version of the Asus software. Not sure if that is what caused it but it worked perfectly fine when I went to bed and I just closed my case leaving it in sleep mode (it should have still been on).  It seemed solidly performing for the price but it also seems there might be glitches in software somewhere as others have mentioned freezing and lock ups.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Dgcl
Reviews.Content: I like it.The resolution is amazing!But the second day, it suddenly it turned offI got to turned it on by pressing the power button and the volume down button at the same time, and now it's still working, so far.

Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING PERFECT EXCEPT MEDIA SUPPORT.IT REALLY SUCKS.YOU CANNOT JUST DRAG AVI FILE IN TO PLAY.YOU NEED TO CONVERT ALL TYPE MEDIA FILES TO MPEG-4 FORMAT WHICH IS REALLY ANNOYING.BUT THE OTHER FEATURES ARE BETTER THAN MY GALXACY TAB 3 8.0.APPEARANCE IS LITTLE BIT CHEAP.

Reviews.Title: MEGA TABLET FOR MEGA PRICE! (UPDATE horrible GPS)
Reviews.Author: Janet Mieses "Janet Mieses"
Reviews.Content: I had a samsung galaxy tab 2 and this beats everything about it, I loved my samsung but  samsung cant beat it for the price, i got this for 129.99 and the samsung for 170 and this uses a quad-core and the colors are simply amazing, it weights less the the samsung and it uses mini usb2 so i can charge it using my PC while the samsung could not  charge with my pc so i had the used the wall charger which was an awful experience. Now i can transfer files via usb while charging. TUPDATE:THE GPS IS BAD, IT USES AGPS instead of real GPS like the tab 2 had, this is huge problem now for me, because in the road offline no wifi it can reach gps but only when the car stops not while running like my tab 2 did.  In other words the tab 2 still has a really good gps system, this one is horrible.

Reviews.Title: doesn't work properly

Reviews.Content: Well recieved this product yesterday and it Just doesn't work properly. The screen does not rotate at all except for certain apps. The netflix app is terrible, I received some sound but there was no video whatsover. Everything else with the tablet i liked, Switching between apps and all the android features seemed to run very well for the price of this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the money but......
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Good tablet but flimsy,  SD card slot does not hold the card securely and card has to be reseated frequently.  Cheap feel, fit and finish are not great.  Functions well, battery life is good, camera is above what I expected. Screen smudges easily and is hard to clean. Would like a hard case/cover but can't find one.  Sits at a sweet spot for price so I would buy again.  Minor upgrades would make this a really sweet tablet.

Reviews.Title: Firmware update doesn't work
Reviews.Author: JCIttner
Reviews.Content: We bought this tablet for 1 very important feature - it runs Android 4.2, which should support multiple users login. It's supposedly to be a family tablet, so daddy, mommy, big sister and little brother can each set up our own login user account. Unfortunately, it runs Android version 4.2.1. So we ran a firmware update, which was supposedly to update to version 4.2.2. Nope, nada! Nothing happens. I just finished an online chat session with ASUS tech support. He's very nice, but he has no idea how to re-trigger the firmware update. Just wait, it takes time for update to fully download, he wrote. Yeah, I don't see it happening any time soon. We are returning this one... :-(
